title: ask() Your User Interface - Extract Arbitrary Information from your Screen with AskUI
excerpt: With AskUI's ask() command you can extract arbitrary data from your User Interface as JSON and use it in your workflows.
content:
You have to deal with contextual data that is only accessible in relation to other elements. Or dynamic data like tables that make it hard to write reliable extraction code.

ask what you want to know and getting it delivered in a structured format like JSON?

ask() command does that and also lets you specify the targeted output format with JSON Schema. In this blog we walk you through the basic usage of ask() can make your AskUI workflows more efficient.

  • IMPORTANT: The https://coreui.io/demos/bootstrap/5.0/free/?theme=light

    ask() Command

    ask() command in its simplest form takes a single prompt as argument. Usually you want to ask a question on the state of your UI or extract a single number. Here are a two example prompts and their outputs:

    -- CODE language-ts line-numbers -- // Example 1 await aui.ask("Please list the social media searches."); # Output [ 'Organic Search', 'Facebook', 'Twitter', 'LinkedIn' ] // Example 2 await aui.ask( "How many new clients?"); # Returned data 9.123

    In the examples above you may have noticed that the output in the first one is an number. The Here is social media example from above that enforces

    Now that we covered the basics. Let us look at two more common examples Extracting Contextual Data

    where something is in your UI in relation to something else. Some common examples are:

      Notification counters
    • Getting the status of an element

    Widgets element in the sidebar has a

    Tables are a tricky thing to extract data from because targeting specific cells needs you to write complex instructions. With the and only want the usage columns, you can write an instruction like this:

    -- CODE language-ts line-numbers -- await aui.ask( "Extract the users from the table.", { json_schema: { "type": "array", "items": { "type": "object", "properties": { "name": { "type": "string" }, "usage": { "type": "number" } }, "additionalProperties": false, "required": ["name", "usage"] }, }, }); # Returned data [ { name: 'Yiorgos Avraamu', usage: 50 }, { name: 'Avram Tarasios', usage: 10 }, { name: 'Quintin Ed', usage: 74 }, { name: 'Ene치s Kwadwo', usage: 98 }, { name: 'Agapetus Tade치코', usage: 22 }, { name: 'Friderik D칙vid', usage: 43 } ]

    AskUI's prompt which specifies what to extract and outputs structured JSON data. You can also specify the JSON Schema the returned data shall have.
